Package lab5

Class RideRequest

java.lang.Object
lab5.RideRequest
public class RideRequest extends Object

The RideRequest class represents a request for a ride service in a ride-sharing or taxi application. This class encapsulates all the necessary information about a ride request, including the customer's name, ride details, price, and discount eligibility.

The RideRequest class provides methods to set and get the details of the ride, manage pricing and discounts, and generate a formatted string representation of the ride request.

It also maintains a static counter to track the number of times its toString method has been called, along with static fields for global settings like tax rate and discount rate.

Key Features:

Manages ride request details such as customer name, ride description, price, and discount status.

Allows for updating and retrieving the current tax rate and discount rate for all ride requests.

Provides a formatted string representation of the ride request details for display or logging purposes.

This class is essential for applications where tracking and managing individual ride requests is necessary.

  • Field Details

    • customerName

      private String customerName
      The name of the customer associated with this ride request. This field stores up to 10 characters representing the customer's name.

    • rideDetails

      private String rideDetails
      Details about the ride requested. This field can store up to 25 characters of information about the ride, such as a description or special requirements.

    • ridePrice

      private double ridePrice
      The price of the ride. This field stores the price as a double precision floating-point number.

    • hasDiscount

      private boolean hasDiscount
      Flag indicating whether the ride receives a discount. This field stores a boolean value: true if there is a discount, false otherwise.

    • taxrate

      private static double taxrate
      The current tax rate for all ride requests. Stored as a static double precision floating-point number.

    • discount

      private static double discount
      The current discount rate for special customers. Stored as a static double precision floating-point number.

    • toStringCounter

      private static int toStringCounter
      Counter for the number of times the toString method has been called. This is a static variable, incremented each time toString is called.

  • Constructor Details

    • RideRequest

      public RideRequest()
      Default constructor for RideRequest. Initializes a new instance of RideRequest with default values: empty strings for customerName and rideDetails, 0.0 for ridePrice, and false for hasDiscount.

    • RideRequest

      public RideRequest(RideRequest other)

      Copy constructor for the RideRequest class. Creates a new instance of RideRequest by copying the state of another RideRequest instance. This includes copying the customer's name, ride details, ride price, and discount status.

      Parameters:
      other - The RideRequest instance to copy from. This should be a non-null instance of RideRequest.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the 'other' RideRequest instance is null.

    • RideRequest

      public RideRequest(String input)

      Constructs a new RideRequest instance based on a provided input string. The input string should be in the format: "[Customer Name],[Ride Description],[Rate],[Discount Status][newline]" with possible whitespace around the beginning and end of each token.

      This constructor trims any whitespace from each token and parses the input string to populate the object's fields. The customer name and ride details are truncated to a maximum of 10 and 25 characters, respectively.

      The discount status can be of two values: 'Y' if a discount should be applied and 'N' otherwise.

      Parameters:
      input - The input string containing the ride request information. Expected format: "[Customer Name],[Ride Description],[Rate],[Discount Status]" Example: " John Doe ,Downtown Tour,50.0,Y\n"
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the input is null, empty, or not in the correct format.

  • Method Details

    • setRideDetails

      public void setRideDetails(String rideDetails)
      Sets the ride details for this RideRequest. This method accepts a string representing extra details about the ride, such as a description or special requirements made by the customer. If the input string is longer than 25 characters, it will be truncated to a maximum length of 25 characters. If the input string is null, the ride details are set to an empty string.
      Parameters:
      rideDetails - The string representing the ride details. The string should be no longer than 25 characters. If the provided string is longer than 25 characters, it will be truncated. If the string is null, the ride details are set to an empty string.

    • setCustomerName

      public void setCustomerName(String customerName)
      Sets the customer's name for this RideRequest. This method accepts a string representing the customer's name. If the input string is longer than 10 characters, it will be truncated to a maximum length of 10 characters. If the input string is null, the customer's name is set to an empty string.
      Parameters:
      customerName - The string representing the customer's name. The string should be no longer than 10 characters. If the provided string is longer than 10 characters, it will be truncated. If the string is null, the customer's name is set to an empty string.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Provides a string representation of the RideRequest instance. This method overrides the default toString method of the Object class. The string representation includes the following information:

      COUNTER: A left-aligned field of size 2, the number of times the toString method has been called, which is tracked by a static counter.

      CUSTOMER_NAME: A left-aligned field of size 10. The customer's name, formatted to a maximum width of 10 characters.

      RIDE_DESCRIPTION: A left-aligned field of size 25. The ride details, formatted to a maximum width of 25 characters.

      PRICE_WITH_TAX: A left-aligned field of size 12 with 2 decimal points precision. The price of the ride with tax, calculated based on the current tax rate.

      PRICE_WITH_DISCOUNT: A right-aligned field of size 13, representing the price with discount for special customers. The price of the ride with discount, if applicable, calculated based on the current discount rate.

      The method formats these details into a structured string format:

      "COUNTER.CUSTOMER_NAME|RIDE_DESCRIPTION|PRICE_WITH_TAX|PRICE_WITH_DISCOUNT"

      where COUNTER is the number of times the toString method has been called, CUSTOMER_NAME is the name of the customer, RIDE_DESCRIPTION is the description of the ride, PRICE_WITH_TAX is the ride price including tax, and PRICE_WITH_DISCOUNT is the ride price with discount applied (if any).
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A formatted string representing the state of the RideRequest object.
